image.altText: A police car along a road in front of a row of houses

props.synopsis: Police are still working to determine the identity of the body which was found this morning in Rhonda Diano Park off Head Street in Braitling.

title.children: Member of the public finds man's body in popular Alice Springs park

image.altText: A stylised image of a partially obscured man's face with scrabble-style tiles flying towards him

props.synopsis: The ABC has identified James Raptis, a lawyer at Australian Community Media, as being linked to a series of websites that were stealing – and mangling – stories from other sites.

title.children: We asked this Australian lawyer if he was behind a 'parasitic' content farm. Hours later it was all taken down

image.altText: Jim Chalmers during Labor caucus meeting__bfadb08a4ff478a0254b937808092f54

props.synopsis: The federal budget will deliver a $9.3 billion surplus for the current financial year, but the next three will each have higher deficits than the government had expected as recently as December.

title.children: Australia is set for a $9.3 billion surplus, but deficits for next three financial years

image.altText: Tradies work on the roof frame of a new home under construction.

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers will hand down his third federal budget tonight, but the government has been steadily drip-feeding key announcements for weeks. Here's everything we already know about what's inside.

title.children: It's budget day — here are the biggest announcements we already know about

image.altText: A graphic showing a woman smiling in a selfie embeded on top of a photo of the front of a house with a police officer.

props.synopsis: A teenager gave a thumbs up before entering a family's home on Boxing Day. What followed destroyed a father and children, who could no longer sleep alone.

title.children: A family was asleep on Boxing Day when a teen on a Christmas bender changed everything

image.altText: A large crocodile inside a trap

props.synopsis: Queensland wildlife officers targeted the large animal after it launched itself out of the water and onto Dean Grieve's houseboat, with authorities concerned crocodiles are being drawn to the area by discarded fish scraps and crab pots.

title.children: Large crocodile puts up a 'fair fight' during removal from marina after lunging at man on houseboat

image.altText: Prince Harry wearing a suit and sunglasses leans in to Meghan Markle wearing sunglasses and a yellow dress.

props.synopsis: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex's 72-hour visit to Nigeria has attracted a level of publicity Buckingham Palace has been sorely lacking of late. Is it a reminder of the "Harry-shaped hole in the monarchy?"

title.children: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's Nigerian tour is a reminder of what might have been

image.altText: Composite of Carmelo Pesce, Sharks CEO Dino Mezzatesta to left and white house surrounded by very green grass to right

props.synopsis: The mayor of the Sutherland Shire, the CEO of the Cronulla Sharks and a Sydney businessman transformed their three-bedroom holiday home south of Sydney into a sprawling eight-bedroom luxury rental without getting development approval.

title.children: The Sydney mayor, the rugby league club boss and their illegal holiday home reno

image.altText: A composite image of David Shoebridge, James Paterson and Peter Khalil.

props.synopsis: Chinese police hunting international corruption targets were allowed into Australia by the federal police and subsequently escorted a woman back to China for trial, in a major breach of Chinese-Australian police protocols.

title.children: 'Extrajudicial extradition': MPs alarmed about Chinese police escorting Australian resident to China for trial

image.altText: A man wearing glasses sits in a darkened room

props.synopsis: A Chinese spy who is now on Australian soil has revealed his incredible story to Four Corners.

title.children: Eric landed in Australia and walked into the ASIO headquarters. 'I'm a Chinese spy,' he declared

image.altText: Explosions go off on a damaged section of bridge, which is leaning against a damaged cargo ship

props.synopsis: The controlled demolition marks a major step in freeing the container ship Dali, which has been stuck amid the wreckage since it lost power and crashed into one of the bridge's support columns shortly after leaving Baltimore on March 26.

title.children: 'Surgical' demolition brings down largest remaining section of Baltimore bridge

image.altText: Two  women walk past the Reserve Bank of Australia headquarters, with the building's name prominent in the background.

props.synopsis: Federal budgets have always been a juggling act, but inflation's belated second wind and a weakening economy means the treasurer must somehow encourage growth without making inflation any worse.

title.children: Competing interests mean this year's budget is the most confusing in years

image.altText: Tasmanian Catholic Archbishop Julian Porteous

props.synopsis: A letter to the parents of Catholic school students in Tasmania detailing a list of grievances by the archbishop, including that the church "cannot stand as we experience our freedoms being taken from us", is criticised by politicians and LGBTIQA+ advocates.

title.children: 'Nothing short of hateful': Letter by Catholic Archbishop to student parents criticised

image.altText: A young white woman with long fair hair standing in a field. She is wearing a green cardigan

props.synopsis: Dozens of patients have contacted the ABC, reporting alarming side effects including vomiting blood and permanent tingling in their fingers after taking replica weight loss drugs.

title.children: Ilisa was vomiting blood after injecting replica Ozempic. The pharmacy kept ringing to sell her more

image.altText: Close up of woman with red hair clamping nose shut with fingers, and staring into camera with furrowed brow.

props.synopsis: Smells wafting over from the neighbours might annoy you, but at what point do they shift from reasonable smells to unreasonable ones? Your rights are explained here.

title.children: 'They stopped entertaining outside': The line between reasonable and unreasonable smells from neighbours

image.altText: A composite image of John Farnham on the left from a Countdown performance. A teenager girl in a blonde wig on the right singing

props.synopsis: While some schools might attempt a classic musical like Grease, this one has looked to Australian music royalty and, in the process, put on the show of a lifetime.

title.children: Belting out John Farnham classics and travelling through time — this musical is like no other

image.altText: Red and yellow lights glowing above land with a plane wing in view

props.synopsis: While the weekend's incredible auroral display might be over, the Sun's antics may still be ramping up over the next few months. Here's what you need to know.

title.children: Researchers believe last weekend's display might not be the only auroras we see this year

image.altText: A courtroom sketch shows Michael Cohen being questioned by a woman as the judge and Donald Trump look on.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's former lawyer Michael Cohen directly implicates the former US president in a hush money scheme, telling jurors that his celebrity client approved hefty payouts to stifle stories that he feared could be harmful to his 2016 White House campaign.

title.children: Former fixer says he acted 'at the direction' of Donald Trump to arrange hush money

image.altText: Screengrab of NSW premier Chris Minns with a neutral expression.

props.synopsis: The NSW government has proposed new laws for those accused of "serious" domestic violence offences to make it harder to secure bail.

title.children: Bail law changes will keep more accused 'serious' domestic violence offenders off the streets, Minns says

image.altText: A young Tongan-Australian woman with long dark hair standing in front of a red wall, with her hand on her chin

props.synopsis: The 28-year-old Sydney writer says Chris Lilley's Jonah was not a fair representation of her community — and her debut novel seeks to set the record straight.

title.children: Attending a 'monocultural' high school taught this Tongan-Australian author to hate herself

image.altText: A young woman holds an item of clothing she created.

props.synopsis: Blending traditional Indigenous techniques with cutting-edge production methods, Renee Henderson creates stunning designs inspired by Aboriginal art and culture.

title.children: Young Wiradjuri designer's pops of colour on show at Australian Fashion Week

image.altText: A police car near parkland

props.synopsis: Police are treating the death of a man in Nerang as suspicious after being called to Glennon Park off Recreation Drive around 6:30am where they discovered a body that had sustained injuries.

title.children: Man's body found in Gold Coast's Glennon Park with death being treated as 'suspicious'

image.altText: An illustration of a depressed girl surrounded by smiling peers

props.synopsis: Girls who go through puberty early are at higher risk of anxiety and depression than their later-developing counterparts. Why does this happen, and how can parents help kids through this time?

title.children: 'It was all pretty confronting': How to support a girl who starts puberty early

image.altText: Waitress holding freshly cooked meals serves them to a table with a smiling couple.

props.synopsis: Almost one million Australians are working two jobs but many still struggle to afford shelter and food.

title.children: Skipping meals and working 80-hour weeks: Australians are holding down multiple jobs to ease cost-of-living pressures

image.altText: Escondida copper mine in Chile, a BHP and Rio Tinto joint venture

props.synopsis:
Mega-miner BHP is not getting bigger today, as the board of Anglo American have rejected a second takeover bid.

The ASX 200 has opened slightly lower as the market awaits the full detail of the federal budget. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: BHP knocked back again in takeover saga, ASX opens slightly lower.

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Consumer spending lifted (!) in transaction data

image.altText: A man holds a placard.

props.synopsis: A Chinese citizen journalist who was jailed for reporting on the outbreak of COVID-19 was due to be released on Monday, but human rights advocates have received no confirmation that she's been freed.

title.children: Fears grow over delay of Wuhan whistleblower's release from prison

image.altText: Image of Melinda French Gates, she is wearing a fuchsia top with a pink flower brooche and smiles into the camera.

props.synopsis: Melinda French Gates will step down as co-chair of the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, the nonprofit she and her ex-husband Bill Gates founded and built into one of the world's largest philanthropic organisations over the past 20 years.

title.children: Melinda French Gates resigns as philanthropy foundation co-chair, three years after her divorce from Bill Gates

image.altText: Tennis player Alex de Minaur, wearing a blue shirt and cap, clenches his fist during a tennis match.

props.synopsis: For just the second time in 13 attempts, Australian number one Alex de Minaur takes down a top 20 player on clay, beating Felix Auger-Aliassime to reach the quarterfinals in Rome.

title.children: Composed and confident, Alex de Minaur claims another impressive win on clay

image.altText: A Queensland player dives while holding the ball to score a try in the Women's State of Origin match against NSW.

props.synopsis: She is already a Dally M Medal winner and a four-time premier, but Queensland fullback Tamika Upton says she is still improving as a player heading into this year's historic three-game Women's State of Origin series.

title.children: How a broken back put Tamika Upton on the path towards State of Origin domination

props.synopsis: NSW shadow minister Matt Kean says nuclear energy is "hugely expensive" and not the path to cheaper electricity as his federal Liberal colleagues campaign for it.

title.children: 'Hugely expensive' nuclear a 'Trojan horse' for coal, NSW Liberal says as energy policy rift exposed

image.altText: Artist Patricia Piccinini stands in front of her giant balloon creation, Skywhale.

props.synopsis: The often-divisive artist shares why her work is driven by a fascination for the frontiers of science and its potential — and her fears of what we're doing to the world.

title.children: She's the mother of Skywhale and a much-loved artist among millennials. Meet Patricia Piccinini
